byline.contributor: Patricia Torres contributed reporting from Caracas.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS CASEY and WILLIAM NEUMAN

abstract: Venezuelan National Guard chief Nestor Reverol will reportedly be charged with drug trafficking in United States; indictment will mark latest in series of charges by United States prosecutors against powerful Venezuelans who allegedly have assumed large role in narcotics trade.
lead_paragraph: Néstor Reverol, head of the country’s National Guard, and Edilberto Molina, a former official in its antidrug unit, are suspected of tipping off crime groups to investigations and raids.

headline.main: Venezuelan Official Is Said to Be Charged in Drug Case in U.S. Court
headline.print_headline: Venezuelan Official Is Said to Be Charged in Drug Case in U.S. Court

snippet: Néstor Reverol, head of the country’s National Guard, and Edilberto Molina, a former official in its antidrug unit, are suspected of tipping off crime groups to investigations and raids.
